Chapter 10, Part 2: The Assembly of Bodhisattvas on the Wonderful and Supreme Palace, Speaking Verses, Part 2
At that time, the Bodhisattva Good Wisdom, receiving the Buddha's spiritual power, universally contemplated the ten directions, and spoke in verse:
Marvelous! The Buddha, the World-Honored One, the immeasurable TathÄgatas,
Free from the mind of harm, liberated, able to liberate themselves and others.
The lamp of the world with right views, as it is, without error,
In immeasurable and countless kalpas, accumulating virtue, therefore seeing the Buddha.
The emptiness of all conditioned phenomena, ordinary beings consider it the truth,
All lack intrinsic nature, all are equal to empty space.
The inexhaustible wisdom expounds, the expounder has nothing to expound,
Knowing that all existences are nonexistent, therefore attaining the inconceivable.
Speaking of the inexhaustible as inexhaustible, because sentient beings are empty and quiescent,
Knowing their true nature, one sees the one of great renown.
Speaking of non-seeing as seeing, speaking of non-self as sentient beings,
Speaking of seeing and sentient beings, these two are both non-existent.
The seer sees nothing, this is the indestructible characteristic of seeing,
This is called the true Dharma, spoken by all Buddhas.
Able to know the true Buddha and what the Buddha speaks,
Universally seeing all worlds, like Buddha Vairocana.
The TathÄgata, the Perfectly Enlightened One, skillfully illuminates the pure path,
Bodhisattva Vigorous Wisdom expounds the immeasurable Dharma.
The characteristics of existent and non-existent dharmas, cultivating the one characteristic equally,
In this way one can see the Buddha, abiding in the true reality.
At that time, Wisdom Bodhisattva, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, universally observed the ten directions and spoke in verse, saying:
Having heard the supreme teaching, I immediately gave rise to the light of pure wisdom,
Universally illuminating the worlds of the ten directions, I saw all the Buddhas.
If one conceives of sentient beings, this is the most difficult place,
The Dharma originally has no true master, but only provisional words and explanations.
The foolish and deluded are unable to know the true nature of their own bodies,
The TathÄgata does not grasp at characteristics, therefore one does not see the Buddha.
The dust and defilements obstruct the eye of wisdom, one does not see the Perfectly Enlightened One,
For immeasurable and innumerable eons, one transmigrates in the ocean of birth and death.
Transmigration is birth and death, non-transmigration is nirvÄá¹‡a,
Birth and death and nirvÄá¹‡a, both are unobtainable.
The false and deceptive one says that birth and death and nirvÄá¹‡a are different,
Deluded by the teachings of the sages, they do not recognize the unsurpassed path.
Thus, those who grasp at characteristics say there is Buddhahood and enlightenment,
Perverted and without right mindfulness, they therefore do not see the Buddha.
Those who know this true Dharma, the characteristics of quiescent true suchness,
Will see the most correct enlightenment, transcending the path of language.
Falsely speaking of all dharmas, the true Dharma is actually non-existent,
All the World-Honored Ones, sought in truth, cannot be obtained.
Clearly understanding the past, future, and present,
Ultimately eternally quiescent, therefore called the TathÄgata.
At that time, True Wisdom Bodhisattva, receiving the Buddha's spiritual power, universally observed the ten directions, and spoke in verse, saying:
Rather endure immeasurable suffering to hear the Buddha's voice,
Not enjoy all pleasures without hearing the Buddha's name.
Therefore, for immeasurable eons, I have undergone this multitude of sufferings and afflictions,
Transmigrating in the cycle of birth and death, because I have not heard the name of the Buddha.
In reality, there are no real dharmas, and the true and false are equal in enlightenment,
Because there are no characteristics of combination, this is called bodhi.
The present Buddha is not a combination of conditions, and the past and future are also thus.
All dharmas are without characteristics, and this is the true nature of the Buddha.
If one is able to contemplate in this way the profound meaning of all dharmas,
Then one will see the immeasurable Buddhas, the true characteristics of the Dharma body.
In reality, knowing what is real as real, and knowing what is not real as not real,
Skillfully understanding the true reality, therefore called right enlightenment.
Enlightenment is without anything to be enlightened to, this is the true and wondrous Dharma of the Buddha.
The Buddhas cultivate in this way, neither one nor two.
Knowing one dharma to be the multitude, knowing the multitude of dharmas to be one,
The Dharma has no place of dependence, how can it be combined through conditions?
The doer and the deed, both are non-existent,
If one can understand in this way, seeking it cannot be attained.
This place cannot be attained, it is the basis of the Buddhas,
The Dharma has no dependence, the enlightened one has no attachment.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Supreme Wisdom, receiving the Buddha's spiritual power, universally observed the ten directions, and spoke in verse, saying:
The unsurpassed MahÄsattva, far removed from the characteristics of sentient beings,
The superior characteristics are non-existent, therefore called unsurpassed.
The subtle is non-existent, the coarse is also non-existent,
What the Buddhas attain is neither expectation nor fabrication.ğŸ”½This Dharma is uncountable, the realm of the Buddhas,
Also apart from the uncountable, this is called the true Dharma of the Buddha.
The sun of wisdom illuminates the ten directions, extinguishing all darkness and obscurity,
Yet it does not illuminate anything, nor does it not illuminate anything.
Always delighting in the Dharma of tranquility, forever free from reliance,
Liberation is without reliance, unstained by any dharma.
The one with great wisdom and insight truly abides in reliance,
If there are no two dharmas, know that one also does not exist.
Without one and without two, all are quiescent and extinguished,
The three realms of existence are empty, this is the vision of the buddhas.
The buddhas teach sentient beings to abide in the true Dharma,
Understanding and penetrating non-abiding, one should see the true body.ğŸ”½The non-body is precisely the body, untransformed and invisible,
Without transformation and without seeing, this is called the unsurpassed body.
The immeasurable buddhadharmas expounded by true wisdom,
If one hears this Dharma, one will always obtain pure eyes.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Firm Wisdom, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, universally observed the ten directions and spoke in verse, saying:
Sentient beings do not know gratitude, but the TathÄgata gives rise to compassionate wisdom,
Appearing in the world, universally illuminating and dispelling the darkness of all.
Giving rise to the mind of great compassion, universally observing all beings,
Fully experiencing immeasurable suffering, eternally bound in the three realms.
Only the equally enlightened, the most honored and supreme guide,
Among all gods and humans, there is no one to take refuge in.
If the world is without a Buddha, and without sages and saints,
Then all those beings will have no happiness at all.
The TathÄgata and the sages and saints appear in the world,
Opening the eye of pure wisdom for them, enabling them to attain eternal peace and happiness.
If one sees the TathÄgata, one attains the greatest benefit.
Hearing the Buddha's name with joy, one becomes a stÅ«pa in the world.
We have attained good benefits, directly seeing the TathÄgata,
Hearing this subtle Dharma, we will all attain Buddhahood.
The bright liberation of the three times, the profound various realms,
All the bodhisattvas, purifying the wisdom eye.
We rejoice again, seeing Buddha Vairocana,
Infinite and boundless wisdom, expounding inexhaustibly.
Unsurpassed wisdom, firm, and the Buddha's disciples,
For countless eons, expounding the Buddha's virtues without end.

Chapter on the Ten Abodes of Bodhisattvas, Part 11 of the Flower Ornament Scripture, Expounded by Buddha At that time, Bodhisattva Dharma Wisdom, empowered by the Buddha's spiritual power, entered the bodhisattvas' samÄdhi of immeasurable skillful means.
Having entered samÄdhi, he saw as many buddhas as there are dust motes in the thousand-fold world systems in the ten directions, each of whom was named DharmÄkara.
At that time, those buddhas said to Bodhisattva DharmÄkara:
Excellent!ğŸ”½Excellent!
Good man!
You are able to enter this bodhisattva's samÄdhi of immeasurable skillful means.
Good man!
The buddhas of the ten directions, as many as dust motes in a thousand buddha lands, empower you, and therefore you are able to enter this samÄdhi.

Moreover, by the power of the original vows of Vairocana Buddha, by the power of his majestic spirit, and by the power of your wholesome roots, and also in order to enable you to expound the Dharma extensively, to nurture the Buddha's wisdom, to open up the Dharma realm, to discern the realm of sentient beings, to eliminate obstructions, to enter the unobstructed realm, to enter the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« of unequaled skillful means and omniscience, to awaken to all dharmas, to skillfully understand the faculties of others, and to expound the Dharma and uphold it, namely the ten abodes of bodhisattvas.
Good man!
You should rely on the Buddha's spiritual power and expound the subtle Dharma.

At that time, all the TathÄgatas bestowed on Dharma Wisdom Bodhisattva the unobstructed cognition, the cognition of non-abiding, the uninterrupted cognition, the non-deluded cognition, the indestructible cognition, the irreproachable cognition, the immeasurable cognition, the unsurpassed cognition, the non-slothful cognition, and the non-regressing cognition.
Why is it so?
Because the power of that samÄdhi and the Dharma are like this.
At that time, the Buddhas each extended their right hands and rubbed the crown of Dharma Wisdom Bodhisattva's head.
After rubbing his crown, he arose from concentration and told the assembly of bodhisattvas:
Disciples of the Buddha!
The lineage of bodhisattvas is profound, vast, and equal to the Dharma realm and space. All bodhisattvas are born from the lineage of the Buddhas of the three times.
Disciples of the Buddha!
The practices of the ten abodes of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have been taught by the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.
What are the ten?

The first is called the initial generation of the mind, the second is called the stage of practice, the third is called the stage of cultivation, the fourth is called the stage of nobility, the fifth is called the stage of perfect skillful means, the sixth is called the stage of right intention, the seventh is called the stage of nonretrogression, the eighth is called the stage of youth, the ninth is called the stage of prince of the Dharma, and the tenth is called the stage of consecration.
Disciples of the Buddha!
These are called the ten abodes of bodhisattvas, taught by the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.
Disciples of the Buddha!
What is the stage of first generating the mind of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
This bodhisattva sees the Buddha's thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks, endowed with wondrous appearance, revered and difficult to encounter;

Or seeing spiritual transformations, or hearing the teaching of the Dharma, or listening to admonitions, or seeing sentient beings undergoing immeasurable suffering, or hearing the TathÄgata's extensive explanation of the Buddha-Dharma, generating the mind of enlightenment, seeking omniscience, and not turning back.
This bodhisattva, due to initially generating the mind, attains the ten powers.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Knowledge of what is possible and impossible, knowledge of the purity of the fruits of actions, knowledge of the faculties, knowledge of desires and inclinations, knowledge of natures, knowledge of all paths and destinations, knowledge of the purity of the arising of all meditations, liberations, samÄdhis, and samÄpattis, knowledge of unobstructed recollection of past lives, knowledge of unobstructed divine eye, and knowledge of the destruction of contaminants in the three times. These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
That bodhisattva should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Learning to respectfully make offerings to the buddhas, praising the bodhisattvas and the mind that protects sentient beings, befriending the wise and praising the irreversible Dharma, cultivating the buddhas' merits and extolling them, being born in the presence of the buddhas, skillfully cultivating the samÄdhi of tranquility, praising the abandonment of the cycle of birth and death, and becoming a refuge for suffering sentient beings.
Why is this?

In order to make the mind of enlightenment increasingly firm and solid, to attain the unsurpassed path, to understand any Dharma that is heard by oneself, and not to rely on the realization of others.
Buddha's disciples!
What is the stage of preparing the ground for bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
This bodhisattva gives rise to ten kinds of minds towards all sentient beings.
What are the ten?
Namely:

The mind of great kindness, the mind of great compassion, the joyful mind, the mind of abiding in peace, the mind of delight, the mind of delivering sentient beings, the mind of protecting sentient beings, the mind of ownership, the mind of a teacher, and the mind of the TathÄgata. These are the ten.
All Buddha's sons!
That bodhisattva should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

First, one should diligently study and seek much learning, cultivate the concentration of detachment from desire, be close to good and virtuous friends and not go against their teachings, skillfully know timely speech, study fearlessness, clearly understand profound meanings, thoroughly penetrate the true Dharma, know the practices of firm dharmas, abandon delusion and confusion, and abide unwaveringly.
Why is this so?
In order to increase great compassion towards all sentient beings;
To understand any Dharma one hears by oneself, without relying on others' enlightenment.
All Buddha's sons!
What is the practice abode of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
This bodhisattva has ten kinds of contemplations of all dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Contemplating all dharmas as impermanent, suffering, empty, without self, and without mastery, all dharmas are not enjoyable, all dharmas have no accumulation or dispersion, all dharmas are not solid, all dharmas are false, and all dharmas have no diligent and solid combination. These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
They should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Studying to discern all realms of sentient beings, discerning all realms of dharmas, discerning all realms of worlds, discerning the realms of earth, water, fire, and wind, discerning the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.
Why is it so?
In order to increase and brighten the wisdom of all dharmas;
To understand all heard dharmas by oneself, without relying on others.
Buddha's disciples!
What is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's abode of noble birth?
This bodhisattva is born from the true teachings of all holy dharmas and cultivates ten kinds of dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Faith in the Buddha is indestructible, ultimately in the Dharma, the mind is tranquil and still, discerning sentient beings, discerning buddha lands, discerning worlds, discerning various karmas, discerning karmic retributions, discerning birth and death, and discerning nirvana. These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
That bodhisattva should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:
Studying to discern the Buddhadharma of the past, future, and present, practicing the Buddhadharma of the past, future, and present;
Fully possessing the Buddhadharma of the past, future, and present, and equally observing all Buddhas.
Why is it so?
In order to make clear and penetrating observation of the two periods of time, to understand the Dharma that is heard, and to awaken to it without relying on others.
Buddha's disciples!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's stage of perfect skillful means?
This bodhisattva hears ten kinds of dharmas and should practice them.
What are the ten?
All the wholesome roots he practices are for:

saving all sentient beings, benefiting all sentient beings, bringing peace and happiness to all sentient beings, having compassion for all sentient beings, perfecting all sentient beings, causing all sentient beings to abandon difficulties, pulling out all sentient beings from the suffering and distress of birth and death, causing all sentient beings to rejoice and be happy, causing all sentient beings to be tamed, and causing all sentient beings to attain nirvÄá¹‡a. This is the stage of perfect skillful means.
Buddha's disciples!
That bodhisattva should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:

They know that sentient beings are boundless, that sentient beings are innumerable, that sentient beings are inconceivable, that sentient beings have various appearances, that sentient beings are immeasurable, that sentient beings are empty, that sentient beings are not in control of themselves, that sentient beings are not real, and that sentient beings have no existence.
Why is it so?
It is in order to cause their minds to be unstained and unattached;
to hear the Dharma and understand it by themselves without relying on others.
Children of the Buddha!
What is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's stage of correct intention?
This bodhisattva, hearing ten kinds of dharmas, attains a determined mind.
What are the ten?

They are:ğŸ”½Hearing praise of the Buddha or criticism of the Buddha, their mind is unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;ğŸ”½Hearing praise of the Dharma or criticism of the Dharma, their mind is unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;
Hearing praise or criticism of the bodhisattvas, their mind is unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;

Hearing praise or slander of the practices of bodhisattvas, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;ğŸ”½Hearing that sentient beings are either limited or unlimited, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;
Hearing that sentient beings are either defiled or undefiled, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;

Hearing that sentient beings are either easy or difficult to liberate, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;ğŸ”½Hearing that the dharma realm is either limited or unlimited, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;
Hearing that the dharma realm is either formed or destroyed, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;
Hearing that the dharma realm is either existent or nonexistent, their minds are unwavering in the Buddha Dharma;
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
Those bodhisattvas should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:

Study that all dharmas are signless, all dharmas are without essence, all dharmas are not to be cultivated, all dharmas are inexistent, all dharmas are unreal, all dharmas are like space, all dharmas are without self-nature, all dharmas are like illusions, all dharmas are like dreams, all dharmas are like echoes.
Why is it so?
In order to attain the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas without retrogression, to understand all heard dharmas by oneself, and not to rely on others for enlightenment.
Children of the buddhas!
What is the stage of non-retrogression for bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
This bodhisattva hears ten kinds of dharmas, and his mind is firm and unmoved.
What are the ten?
They are:ğŸ”½Hearing that there are buddhas and that there are no buddhas, he does not retrogress from the Buddha Dharma. There are dharmas and there are no dharmas,
he does not retrogress from the Buddha Dharma. There are bodhisattvas and there are no bodhisattvas, in the Buddha Dharma,
In the middle, there is no turning back, there is bodhisattva practice, there is no bodhisattva practice, in the Buddha Dharma there is

no turning back, bodhisattva practice gives rise to birth and death, does not give rise to birth and death, in the Buddha Dharma there isğŸ”½no turning back, there are past buddhas, there are no past buddhas, in the Buddha Dharma there is no turning back, there are
future buddhas, there are no future buddhas, in the Buddha Dharma there is no turning back, there are present buddhas, there are
no present buddhas, in the Buddha Dharma there is no turning back, the Buddha's wisdom has an end, has no end, in the Buddha Dharma there is
no turning back, the dharmas of the three times are of one characteristic, are not of one characteristic, in the Buddha Dharma there is no turning back - these are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
Those bodhisattvas should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:

Knowing that one is precisely many, and many is precisely one, according to the flavor one knows the meaning, and according to the meaning one knows the flavor. Knowing that non-existence is existence, and existence is non-existence. Knowing that characteristics are not characteristics, and characteristics are characteristics. Knowing that nature is not nature, and nature is nature.
Why is it so?
In order to be fully endowed with skillful means in all dharmas, one will understand the heard Dharma by oneself, without relying on others for realization.
Children of the Buddhas!
What is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's stage of youthfulness?
This bodhisattva attains mental stability in ten kinds of dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:

Pure bodily actions, pure verbal actions, pure mental actions, freely taking rebirth according to one's wishes, knowing the minds of sentient beings, knowing the various desires and pleasures of sentient beings, knowing the various natures of sentient beings, knowing the various karmas of sentient beings, knowing the formation and destruction of worlds, and being unobstructed in freely using spiritual powers. These are the ten.
Children of the buddhas!
Those bodhisattvas should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Studying to know all buddha lands, shaking all buddha lands, upholding all buddha lands, contemplating all buddha lands, going to all buddha lands, going everywhere in all worlds, skillfully asking about immeasurable wonderful dharmas, the spiritual powers and transformations, the immeasurable bodies, skillfully understanding the immeasurable various sounds, and in a single thought respectfully making offerings to immeasurable buddhas.
Why is it so?
Desiring to skillfully manifest in all dharmas, to be fully accomplished, to understand any heard dharma by oneself, without relying on the realization of others.
Children of the buddhas!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's abode of the Dharma prince?
This bodhisattva skillfully understands ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

They are well versed in the destinies of sentient beings, well versed in the various afflictions, well versed in the various habitual tendencies, well versed in skillful means and wisdom, well versed in discerning immeasurable dharmas, well versed in the various deportments, well versed in discerning the various worlds, well versed in the past, future, and present, well versed in speaking of the conventional truth, and well versed in speaking of the ultimate truth. These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
Those bodhisattvas should study ten dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:

Studying to know well the abode of the Dharma King, knowing well the conduct and deportment of the Dharma King, knowing well how to establish the abode of the Dharma King, knowing well how to skillfully enter the abode of the Dharma King, knowing well how to discern the abode of the Dharma King, knowing well how to pour the sweet dew of the Dharma King's consecration, knowing well how to uphold the Dharma of the Dharma King, knowing well the Dharma of fearlessness of the Dharma King, knowing well the Dharma of non-attachment of the Dharma King, and knowing well how to praise the Dharma of the Dharma King.
Why is it so?
If one wishes to attain unobstructed cognition with regard to all dharmas, and to understand any dharma one hears by oneself without relying on others for realization.
Children of the Buddhas!
What is the stage of consecration of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas?
This bodhisattva accomplishes ten kinds of cognition and abides [in them].
What are the ten?
Namely:

Shaking immeasurable worlds, illuminating immeasurable worlds, upholding immeasurable worlds, traveling to immeasurable worlds, purifying immeasurable worlds, knowing the mental activities of immeasurable beings, knowing the mental activities of beings according to their minds, knowing the faculties of immeasurable beings, skillfully liberating immeasurable beings, and subduing immeasurable beings. These are the ten.
Children of the Buddhas!
That bodhisattva's body is unknowable;
his physical actions, spiritual powers, and mastery of spiritual powers;
The knowledge of the past, the knowledge of the future, the knowledge of the present, the knowledge of purifying buddha-lands, the realm of the mind, and the realm of knowledge are unknowable;
All sentient beings, up to the Dharma Prince Bodhisattvas, are all unable to know.
Buddha's disciples!
That Bodhisattva should study ten kinds of knowledge.
What are the ten?
They are:

Studying the knowledge of the three times, the knowledge of all Buddha Dharmas, the unobstructed knowledge of the Dharma realm, the immeasurable and boundless knowledge of the Dharma realm, the knowledge filling all worlds, the knowledge universally illuminating all worlds, the knowledge able to uphold all worlds, the knowledge discerning all sentient beings, the knowledge of all kinds of knowledge, and the immeasurable and boundless knowledge of the Buddha.
Why is it so?
In order to be fully endowed with the knowledge of all kinds, to understand all heard dharmas by oneself, without relying on enlightenment from others.

At that time, by the Buddha's spiritual power, the buddha-lands in the ten directions, as numerous as dust particles in ten thousand buddha-realms, shook in six ways and manifested eighteen aspects, raining down celestial precious flowers, celestial powdered incense, celestial jeweled garlands, celestial mixed incense, celestial precious garments, celestial precious clouds, and celestial adornments. Celestial wonderful music played without being struck, and it naturally emitted the sound of fearlessness.

Just as on the summit of Mount Sumeru in this four-continent world, in the Palace of Wonderful Victory, the spiritual transformations and the teaching of the ten abodes were like this, so it was also in all the worlds in the ten directions.

At that time, by the Buddha's spiritual power, from beyond the lands as numerous as dust particles in ten thousand buddha-realms in the ten directions, great bodhisattvas as numerous as the dust particles in ten buddha-realms filled the ten directions and came to this land, saying these words:ğŸ”½Excellent!
Excellent!
Child of Buddha, you have skillfully taught this Dharma. We all have the same name, Dharma Wisdom;
The country from which they came was all named Dharma Cloud;
The tathÄgatas there were all named Wonderful Dharma;
In the buddha lands of those buddhas, they also expounded the ten abodes.
The names, phrases, and sentences of the retinue of great assemblies were all the same, without any difference.
Therefore, Buddha's disciples!
We, by the Buddha's spiritual power, have come to this land to bear witness for you.

In this way, on the summit of Mount Sumeru in the four continents, in the Wonderful Victory Palace, the Dharma of the ten abodes was expounded. Bodhisattvas equal in number to the dust particles in ten buddha-realms came here to bear witness. It was the same in all the ten directions.
At that time, the Bodhisattva Dharma Wisdom, receiving the Buddha's spiritual power, universally contemplated the ten directions and all dharma realms, and spoke in verse, saying:
Seeing the subtle body of the Great Wisdom Honored One, with all the excellent characteristics fully complete,
Most supreme, respected, and very difficult to encounter, the courageous great being first gives rise to the mind of enlightenment.
Seeing the great supernatural powers of the unequaled one, hearing the wonderful Dharma and instructions,
Observing the immeasurable suffering in the five realms, the fearless great being first gives rise to the mind of enlightenment.
Hearing that the TathÄgatas, the Honored Ones of Universal Wisdom, are fully endowed with immeasurable merits,
Understanding that the characteristics of the Buddha's mind are like empty space, the bodhisattva gives rise to the mind of enlightenment for this reason.
Being able to know what is possible and what is impossible, what is self and what is not self, and so forth,
Desiring to understand the meaning of equality and reality, the bodhisattva gives rise to the mind of enlightenment for this reason.
In the past, future, and present worlds, all the good and evil karmic retributions,
Desiring to skillfully observe them all equally, the bodhisattva gives rise to the mind of enlightenment for this reason.
The various dhyÄna concentrations and liberations, following the samÄdhi without attachment,
Desiring to skillfully distinguish the arising of defilement and purity, the bodhisattva gives rise to the mind of enlightenment for this reason.
The various diligent practices and powers of effort,
They all wish to understand and distinguish them, and thus bodhisattvas first give rise to their minds.ğŸ”½The various desires of all sentient beings,
The mind delights in and clings to various hopes and wishes,
They all wish to understand and distinguish them, and thus bodhisattvas first give rise to their minds.ğŸ”½The various natures of all sentient beings,
Immeasurable, boundless, and innumerable,
They all wish to understand and distinguish them, and thus bodhisattvas first give rise to their minds.ğŸ”½All the paths that have been reached,
The eightfold noble path leading to the unconditioned,
They all wish to understand and know their reality, and thus bodhisattvas first give rise to their minds.ğŸ”½All the various kinds of sentient beings in the worlds,
Transmigrating in the five destinies of the ocean of birth and death,
Wishing to attain the heavenly eye and understand everything, bodhisattvas first give rise to their minds for this reason.
All matters in the past, according to their essential nature and characteristics,
Wishing to understand and follow them all, the Bodhisattva thus initiates the initial thought of enlightenment.
All afflictions in the world, all bonds and remaining habitual tendencies,
Wishing to awaken to and ultimately exhaust them all, the Bodhisattva thus initiates the initial thought of enlightenment.
All worldly conventional truths, names, discussions, and ways of speaking,
Wishing to clearly understand the meaning of conventional truth, the Bodhisattva thus initiates the initial thought of enlightenment.
All dharmas are cut off from language, without self-nature like space,
Wishing to clearly understand the meaning of ultimate truth, the Bodhisattva thus initiates the initial thought of enlightenment.
Shaking all Buddha-lands, overturning and stirring up the great oceans,
Wishing to clearly understand the Buddha's spiritual powers, the Bodhisattva thus initiates the initial thought of enlightenment.
